definition: vocational high school/abbr. to 技校[ji4 xiao4]

sentences.english: The fighter also carried an astromech droid for onboard repairs.
sentences.chinese: 战斗机上也有宇航技工机器人负责机载维修。

sentences.english: In the shop, mechanics prepare the iron grapples — as they're called — for shipping.
sentences.chinese: 在店里，技工们为了他们所谓的航运在准备铁吊斗。

sentences.english: As pharmacy chains face squeezes on profit margins, the use of techs is growing.
sentences.chinese: 配药连锁店由于利润幅度紧缩，使用的技工越来越多。

sentences.english: He then worked as a mechanic on Italian motorcycles.
sentences.chinese: 而后他在意大利的摩托车机修厂做技工。
高密市技工学校机械厂。

sentences.english: High technology artificer fabrication, stardard cementation, effect is also very satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 高技术的技工，正规粘结，效果也是很满意的。

sentences.english: Why don't you give the inlays to the mechanic?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不补牙的工作交给技工呢？
彼得是一个心灵手巧的技工。

sentences.english: This article has analyzed the quality requirements for technical school teachers in supervising practice.
sentences.chinese: 文章阐述了对技工学校实习指导教师的素质要求。

sentences.english: Since the present condition of skilled workers is not optimistic, high vocational education has a long way to go under new situation.
sentences.chinese: 在新形势下高职教育任重道远，技工现状不容乐观。

sentences.english: The mechanic removed the cowling in order to repair the plane's engine.
sentences.chinese: 那个技工拆下了飞机引擎罩修理引擎。

sentences.english: He wants to import qualified workers on a Canadian-style points system.
sentences.chinese: 他想用加拿大的移民积分系统来引进技工。

sentences.english: Data in this table excludes technical schools.
sentences.chinese: 本表数据未包括技工学校数。

sentences.english: The tomb contained what some archaeologists think may be one of the original craftsmen.
sentences.chinese: 该墓可能是一些考古学家认为的最早的技工之一。

sentences.english: Interprovincial trade certification (Red Seal) is also available to qualified construction electricians.
sentences.chinese: 省际技工证书对于合格建筑电工也是有效的。

definition: vocational high school/abbr. for 技工學校|技工学校[ji4 gong1 xue2 xiao4]/abbr. for 技術學校|技术学校[ji4 shu4 xue2 xiao4]
kind of work in production (e.g. benchwork, foundry work etc)
